ratings.comment: Professor Zimmerman is one of the most celebrated organic chemists in the history of time. His contributions to science were nothing less than astounding. You're fortunate to have him as a teacher. Get off your butts and learn to study! He's highly conversant, intelligible, easy to understand, and takes interest in his students.

Easiest to get an A if you can get a hold of his old exams.  Be careful of common molecule names and you still have to go to lecture to hear little details he'll put on the quizzes and exams.  If you want to learn OChem for the MCAT though, don't take this with him.  He's very incoherent because he has a German accent and had a stroke.
He's a cute old man, grandpa-like, but DO NOT TAKE HIM for ochem if you actually want to learn anything. You'll get an A with minimal effort, but when the MCAT rolls around you'll be screwed.
Serious students should not take this class.  Don't bother asking for help or trying to understand the material.  The Chemistry Department knows there is a problem and will not do anything about it.
Memorizing tests and learning are very different.  Students who want to learn the material should not take this class.

So many people say he's terrible... okay, so his teaching is subpar, but if you take notes, look them over for ~45 min the night before the quiz, and get hold of old quizzes, you'll get something like 95-100% no problem. Get a 100 on his 1st exam and he'll invite you to do research in his lab!

I am sure he was a brilliant professor at one point during his career but someone has to help him give up teaching.  It really isn't fair for students who want to learn and prepare themselves especially for the MCAT.
Wonder when the University will stop exposing students to this and calling it teaching
cant understand a word he says, he's basically deaf, doesn't appreciate people asking questions. horrible teacher

He's a brilliant man, and I'm sure he has done wonders for organic research, but he is a truly horrible  professor. If you are only concerned with getting an A, then his course is the one to take, but if you plan to take the MCATs, be well aware that Zimmerman's course will not prepare you at all, and you won't learn ANYTHING.

Absolutely worthless!!!  I think he has finally figured out that people just look at the old exams so he tries to get all tricky by changing minor details that mess you up if you have just memorized the old quizzes.  Take anyone but him!! I have learned ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!!
One token of advice:  Memorize the old exams.  If you do, you'll get an A without having to study.  If not, you'll be totally screwed.

Great lectures!  He makes his expectations clear for each section and goes over most of them.  His use of colored chalks makes mechanisms much easier to follow.  He does use the same problems year after year, and many students benefit from memorizing old quizes and exams (if you have the connections).  Be aware that there IS NO PARTIAL CREDIT!!!

Worst Professor Ever! As long as you have the old tests, simply MEMORIZE THEM... in detail. The tests are all or nothing. Either way, you won't learn a single thing and you'll mostly sleep in class. Don't take this class if you actually want to learn anything in college.
Wow.  That's all I have to say.  I have NOT opened my textbook once, I just memorized old exams and I have gotten 100% on all 10 quizzes so far and 100% on both exams so far.  Take him, seriously.
Worthless.  You will learn nothing in this class. Get the old exams and you are set.

If you have to take a year of ochem, take Reich first so you learn a lot, then take Zimmerman second semester. Everything you learned from Reich will give you the background youll need, and the old tests and quizzes will give you everything else. I hope you have a friend who can hook you up.

Wow.  What a great guy.  I got an A.  I'm so happy.    MEMORIZE THE OLD EXAMS.  GET AS MANY OLD EXAMS AS YOU CAN.  you may think that he came up with a whole new set of questions for a certain exam, but if you go back far enough into his older exams, you will find that they were simply old questions that hadn't been used for a while.

Wow, what a dirty old man. Whatever happened to old people being jolly? In any case, the class is really easy if you memorize the old exams, but don't plan on learning anything. For such a brilliant man, he really is a terrible teacher
so he may not be the best professor you've ever had, at least you can walk out of 2nd semester ochem with an A.  and to me, that's all that matters.

I don't care what anyone says ZImmerman's anecdotes are hilarious because he is soo old and soo absent minded.  If you can get old exams and quizzes...YOU WILL GET AN A.  The quizzes and exams are almost problem for problem from the old material.  Sooo much easier than my 343 class.
I agree completely with the guy who posted on 1/19/06.  This is the teacher you need to take for 345.

Easily distracted. He would often get half-way through a mechanism, forget where he was, then move on to a completely different topic. He also spends a lot of time talking about things completely unrelated to chemistry, including one memorable story (roughly 5-6 min in length) about someone he knows who REALLY likes the color blue.

Very easy class if you can memorize.  Treasure the packet of old quizzes he hands out at the beginning of the semester.  He is diffeicult to understand at first, but his lectures are relevant so I would suggest attending.  He actually tests on what he lectures on!
This man is a giant in his field and a national treasure.  If we are even a fraction as with it as this guy is at his age, we will be blessed.  Learn as much as you can from him.

This guy sounds like Elmer Fudd sucking on a life saver.  His lectures were unorganized and hard to follow, he teaches specifically this plus this gives that, but not why or how the reactions occur.  The tests aren't that bad if you memorize everything you can get your hands on from previous years, but you don't actually learn anything.  at all.

Professor Zimmerman was terrible. Impossible to understand, totally senile, and mean to boot. Don't listen to people who say he is nice- he is a nasty curmudgeon, and you won't learn a thing. The only possible upshot is for people who are really good at memorization- that's how you pass his class.

He mumbles on top of his German accent, so you don't ever know what he's saying. When he lectures, he doesn't teach you general reactions and the basic concepts, just specific compounds when treated with this you'll get this specific compound. Book doesn't help, it makes it worse. He loves old chemical names even though they're useless, so you better memorize that and your notes. If you're lucky to get old tests from your friends, you can memorize and pass. If not, suffer like I did.
No Comments
sucks

Ok, seriously he's not as good as some of these people make him out to be and he's not as bad as the others complain about.  Yes, he's old and it's hard to understand him at first.  He seems to be everywhere with his notes and it might be tough to understand.  His exams are photocopies with the questions rearranged.  You still learn a lot from him.

The worst lecture professor you could probablly ever got stuck with.He has an odd speach impediment and you usually can't understand him.He heavily recycles his tests and test questions so one can get a C purely by memorization, but the class isn't curved so pulling off a 90% is sometimes difficult

I really like professor Zimmerman. He has fun and makes class interesting. He isn't a big fan of the book so you really don't have to read it. He quizzes and tests are only what he lectures on. I'm pretty sure he is 82 and the fact that he can do all that lecturing at that age is pretty amazing!
Worst class I have ever taken in college.  He should retire.  Unless you're good at memorizing things straight-up, you won't do well on his tests.  Learning the material won't get you a good grade.

Has to be one of the most entertaining professors that I have ever had.  Sure, you don't learn as much chemistry in his lectures, but if you take the time to talk with the man, he is brilliant! (He also tells funny stories.)
one of the worst professor i ever know...he's too old to be teaching...the whole class is a joke...don't take his class...take someone else's, you won't regret it...
My favorite class. He is a pure researcher ... he was elected to the Nat'l Academy of Sciences. You learn more than just material from the text.

Could be one of the smartest men I have ever met.  Lecures were fascinating, and he really wanted his students to do well.  I don't understand the other comments here.  Just because he is elderly does not make him a bad teacher.
No Comments

I am not a memorizer, and even though he claims that nothing he teaches needs to be memorized, that's all you need to know how to do to pass. Quizes are made directly from lecture notes, and exams directly from quizes. Do not take if you want to know what's going on.
He is awesome
His lectures are bad.  He rambles and goes on about random things not related to chem.  his exams are almost exactly like the quizes, so that's a plus.
He dislikes teaching and hates students that aren't as smart as he is.
despite what the other ratings say, if you're looking for the easiest 345 class, without a doubt, it's his class.  he may be old, but he still wants his students to do well.

Be ready to cram names/reactions into your head FAST.  Don't expect partial credit.  You will learn some flat-out WRONG chemistry in order to answer his questions "correctly".  Fortunately (?) you will remember nothing once you're done with
You will learn this entire course on your own if you take it from him.
Take this guy for chem 345, easiest A you will ever get in organic chemistry.
too old to teach.

Please do not enroll in his class. It is frustrating to watch him fumble around and mutter to the blackboard. His mind is no longer sharp, and he cannot understand the questions his students are asking him.
No Comments
he should retire

This man should retire.  He is easily in his 80s and has had a stroke which impairs his speech.  You will get little from lecture and must learn a difficult subject on your own.  The only plus is that his test questions are predictable.  Testing condition
